methods.name: amp()
methods.desc: Change the amplitude/volume of this audiosample.

methods.name: channels()
methods.desc: Returns the number of channels in the audiosample.

methods.name: cue()
methods.desc: Cues the playhead to a fixed position in the audiosample.

methods.name: cueFrame()
methods.desc: Cues the playhead to a fixed position in the audiosample.

methods.name: duration()
methods.desc: Returns the duration of the audiosample in seconds.

methods.name: frames()
methods.desc: Returns the number of frames of the audiosample.

methods.name: jump()
methods.desc: Jump to a specific position in the audiosample without interrupting playback.

methods.name: jumpFrame()
methods.desc: Jump to a specific position in the audiosample without interrupting playback.

methods.name: loop()
methods.desc: Starts playback which loops from the beginning to the end of the sample.

methods.name: play()
methods.desc:
Starts the playback of the audiosample. Only plays to the end of the
 audiosample once.

methods.name: playFor()
methods.desc:
Starts the playback of the audiosample for the specified duration or to the
 end of the audiosample, whichever comes first.

methods.name: rate()
methods.desc: Set the playback rate of the audiosample.

methods.name: resize()
methods.desc:
Resizes the underlying buffer of the audiosample to the given number of
 frames.

methods.name: sampleRate()
methods.desc: Returns the underlying sample rate of the audiosample.

methods.name: pan()
methods.desc: Move the sound in a stereo panorama. Only works for mono audiosamples!

methods.name: set()
methods.desc: Set multiple parameters at once

methods.name: stop()
methods.desc: Stops the playback.

methods.name: position()
methods.desc:
Get current sound file playback position in seconds.
 
 Note that, if this audio sample was at some point played back in parallel
 (triggered by another call to play() before the original playback had finished),
 the position returned by this function can be of any of the concurrent playbacks,
 not necessarily the last one that was triggered.

methods.name: positionFrame()
methods.desc:
Get frame index of current sound file playback position.
 
 Note that, if this audio sample was at some point played back in parallel
 (triggered by another call to play() before the original playback had finished),
 the position returned by this function can be of any of the concurrent playbacks,
 not necessarily the last one that was triggered.

methods.name: percent()
methods.desc:
Get current sound file playback position in percent.
 
 Note that, if this audio sample was at some point played back in parallel
 (triggered by another call to play() before the original playback had finished),
 the position returned by this function can be of any of the concurrent playbacks,
 not necessarily the last one that was triggered.

methods.name: pause()
methods.desc: Stop the playback of the sample, but cue it to the current position.

methods.name: read()
methods.desc:
Read some frames of this audio sample into an array. Stereo samples
 contain two data points per frame.

methods.name: write()
methods.desc:
Write some frames of this audio sample. Stereo samples require two data
.points per frame.

description:
This class allows you low-level access to an audio buffer to create, access,
 manipulate and play back sound samples.
 
 If you want to pre-load your audio sample with an audio file from disk you
 can do so using the SoundFile subclass.
name: AudioSample

parameters.name: frames
parameters.description: the desired number of frames for this audiosample

parameters.name: stereo
parameters.description:
whether to treat the audiosample as 2-channel (stereo) or not
            (default: false)

parameters.name: frameRate
parameters.description: the underlying frame rate of the sample (default: 44100)

parameters.name: data
parameters.description:
an array of float values to be used as this audiosample's sound
            data. The audiosample will consequently have as many frames as the
            length of the given array.
